text: Raising Money: Using Linear Relationships to Solve Problems

In Problems 1.1 and 1.2, the distance walked depended on the time. This tells us that distance is the dependent variable and time is the independent variable. For the linear relationships in Problem 1.2, we also noticed that as the independent variable changed by a constant amount, the dependent variable changed by a constant amount. This pattern of change is called the rate of change.

The students in Ms. Changâ€™s class are trying to estimate how much money they might raise for charity by doing a walkathon. Each participant in the walkathon must find sponsors to pledge a certain amount of money for each kilometer they walk. The class refers to these as pledge plans.

Several questions come up in their discussions:

  • What variables can affect the amount of money that is collected?
  • How can we use these variables to estimate the amount of money each student will collect?
  • Will the amount of money collected be the same for each walker?
